document.masterDocTitle: The aphrophorid spittlebugs of Iran (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The aphrophorid spittlebugs of Iran (Hemiptera: Cercopoidea: Aphrophoridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Poophilus nebulosus
has been listed in a number of publications dealing with the fauna of Iran . Examination of the male genitalia indicated that there are no significant differences between it and the widespread
P. costalis
. Accordingly
P. nebulosus
is considered a junior synonym of this species.

Distribution and habitat.
Poophilus costalis
is considered to be a generalist and feeds from 37 plant species in Africa and Asia (
Shih et al . 2005
). The collecting data of our examined material shows the activity of this species from the elevation of 0 m to 1960m . In the literature, the present of the species have been recorded on halophilic plants, in dried rice fields, steppes with zygophyllaceous plants and on
Tamarix
and
Alhagi
as well (
Dlabola 1981
;
Barkhordari et al . 1981
;
Yaghmaee 2008
). It has been mentioned as a pest on sorghum in Niger (
Ajayi & Oboite 1999
;
Akinkunmi et al. 2012
) and
Abaii ( 2000 )
recorded the species as a mild pest on
Tamarix
in Iran .
Poophilus costalis (Walker)
is the most widely distributed species, being found in almost all African countries and also extending across Asia (nearly all parts of Iran in fig. 20 ) to China , and Korea .
